t: Psalm 35
Great Is the Lord
Of David.
Contend,*pn O Lord,*s with those who contend with me; fight*ld against those who fight against me!
Take*ln hold of shield and buckler and*ld rise for my help!
Draw*ln the spear and javelin against*ld my pursuers! Say*ln to my soul, “I*ld am your salvation!”
Let*pn them be put to shame and dishonor who*ld seek after my life! Let*ln them be turned back and disappointed who*ld devise evil against me!
Let*ln them be like chaff before the wind, with*ld the angel of the Lord*s driving them away!
Let*ln their way be dark and slippery, with*ld the angel of the Lord*s pursuing them!
For*pn without cause they hid their net for me; without*ld cause they dug a pit for my life.
Let*ln destruction come upon him when he does not know it! And*ln let the net that he hid ensnare him; let*ld him fall into it— to his destruction!
Then*pn my soul will rejoice in the Lord,*s exulting*ld in his salvation.
All*ln my bones shall say, “O*ld Lord,*s who is like you, delivering*ln the poor from*ld him who is too strong for him, the*ld poor and needy from him who robs him?”
Malicious*pn witnesses rise up; they*ld ask me of things that I do not know.
They*ln repay me evil for good; my*ld soul is bereft.
But*ln I, when they were sick— I*ld wore sackcloth; I*ld afflicted myself with fasting; I*ln prayed with head bowed on my chest.
I*ld went about as though I grieved for my friend or my brother; as*ln one who laments his mother, I*ld bowed down in mourning.
But*pn at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered; they*ld gathered together against me; wretches*ln whom I did not know tore*ld at me without ceasing;
like*ln profane mockers at a feast, they*ld gnash at me with their teeth.
How*pn long, O Lord, will you look on? Rescue*ld me from their destruction, my*ld precious life from the lions!
I*ln will thank you in the great congregation; in*ld the mighty throng I will praise you.
Let*pn not those rejoice over me who*ld are wrongfully my foes, and*ln let not those wink the eye who*ld hate me without cause.
For*ln they do not speak peace, but*ld against those who are quiet in the land they*ld devise words of deceit.
They*ln open wide their mouths against me; they*ld say, “Aha, Aha! Our*ld eyes have seen it!”
You*pn have seen, O Lord;*s be not silent! O*ld Lord, be not far from me!
Awake*ln and rouse yourself for my vindication, for*ld my cause, my God and my Lord!
Vindicate*ln me, O Lord,*s my God, according*ld to your righteousness, and*ld let them not rejoice over me!
Let*ln them not say in their hearts, “Aha,*ld our heart’s desire!” Let*ln them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
Let*pn them be put to shame and disappointed altogether who*ld rejoice at my calamity! Let*ln them be clothed with shame and dishonor who*ld magnify themselves against me!
Let*pn those who delight in my righteousness shout*ld for joy and be glad and*ld say evermore, “Great*ln is the Lord,*s who*ld delights in the welfare of his servant!”
Then*ln my tongue shall tell of your righteousness and*ld of your praise all the day long.
